metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9080 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Memory safety bugs were reported in Firefox 50.0.2. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort that some of these could be exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 50.1.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9080` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 50.1.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 50.1.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 50.1.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 50.1.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '50.1.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
